artist: Designer: Peter Bateman; Designer: Ann Bateman
creditline: Gift of Leo A. and Doris Hodroff
description: oval reeded foot; boat shaped bodies with handles and threaded borders; engraved with monograms
markings: marks, on bottom of each and front and aback of .1; stickers, on bottom of each; inscriptions including \'London 1794\', on bottom of each; \'TEG\', monogram, on front of .2
text: Intended for sugar or sweetmeats, these boat-shaped baskets are typical of the silver produced by the famous Bateman family shop under Peter and Ann Bateman.  Peter Bateman, the second son of silversmiths Jonathan and Hester Bateman (whose work is featured in the adjacent case), worked under his father's, then mother's mark, until he and his brother Jonathan took over the family firm in 1790.  Jonathan Bateman died the next year, leaving his widow Ann to take his place.
title: Sugar basket
